Closed captions. Press the spacebar to toggle captions on and off.

slidelink.displaytext: Working Together to Advance Science and Save Lives
Who are Bio-Rad's Life Science customers?
Who are Bio-Rad's Clinical Diagnostics customers?

search.slidetext: contains audio duration: 15 minutes introduction to bio-rad’s product portfolio

learning objectives explain how all roles at bio-rad help to advance science and save lives describe the two exciting markets that bio-rad sells into: life sciences and clinical diagnostics define bio-rad’s product areas describe the different types of customers that bio-rad supports
training overview amplification immunoassays chromatography cell biology western blot quality controls introduction to bio-rad’s product portfolio
advancing science and saving lives 70+ years 8600+ employees
working together to advance science and save lives every one of us has an impact and makes a difference.

you must visit both the ”life science” and ”clinical diagnostics” sections before continuing. clinical diagnostics healthcare diagnostics clinical diagnostics healthcare diagnostics clinical diagnostics healthcare diagnostics clinical diagnostics healthcare diagnostics major markets life sciencebiological research life sciencebiological research life sciencebiological research life sciencebiological research select each to learn more

clinical diagnostics clinical diagnostics /ˈklinək(ə)lˌdīəɡˈnästik/ noun a process to identify a disease, condition, or injury based on the signs and symptoms a patient is having and the patient's health history and physical exam. a market comprised of customers who are performing fda-approved clinical diagnostic tests on human samples, such as saliva or blood, for health care providers to use in the care of that individual patient. synonyms healthcare diagnostics

clinical diagnostics group clinical diagnostics group quality systems core diagnostics immunohematology clinical systems infectious disease clinical immunology responsible for bio-rad’s quality control products and solutions quality systems responsible for bio-rad’s blood typing and transfusion products and solutions immuno-hematology responsible for bio-rad’s hemoglobinopathies and diabetes testing products and solutions clinical systems responsible for bio-rad’s instruments and solutions used to detect different types of infectious diseases infectious disease responsible for bio-rad’s autoimmune testing products and solutions clinical immunology clinical diagnostics group clinical diagnostics group quality systems core diagnostics immunohematology clinical systems infectious disease clinical immunology

who are bio-rad’s clinical diagnostics customers? hospital labs laboratory services providers who are bio-rad’s clinical diagnostics customers? hospital labs laboratory services providers attached to a hospital run routine clinical testing on patient samples in order to provide crucial data needed to diagnose and treat diseases hospital labs not attached to a hospital sent patient samples by hospitals that choose to outsource their testing provide hospitals the crucial test results needed to diagnose and treat diseases follow the same strict regulations as a hospital laboratory service providers

life sciences life sciences /līf ˈsīəns/ noun the sciences and research concerned with the study of living organisms. a market comprised of customers who are researching diseases, therapeutic drugs, veterinary medicine, food safety, and other areas that improve the lives of living organisms.

life science group life science group digital biology food science gene expression protein purification protein quantitation flow and antibody bio education life science group life science group life science group life science group digital biology food science gene expression protein purification protein quantitation flow and antibody bio education life science group life science group digital biology food science gene expression protein purification protein quantitation flow and antibody bio education responsible for bio-rad’s droplet digital pcr products and solutions digital biology responsible for bio-rad’s flow cytometry and antibody products flow and antibody responsible for bio-rad’s standard and real-time pcr products and solutions gene expression responsible for all bio-rad products that are part of the food and drink testing portfolio food science responsible for bio-rad’s chromatography products and solutions protein purification responsible for bio-rad’s electrophoresis, imaging, western blot, and immunoassay products and solutions protein quantitation

who are bio-rad’s life science customers? food science labs educational institutions biopharma academic research labs focused on developing new therapeutic drugs subject to strict regulations and testing requirements set in place by regulatory agencies biopharma performing research in a wide range of biological areas for instance, studying diseases in humans universities, community colleges, and high schools teaching future generations of scientists testing takes place to ensure the safety of food academic research labs educational institutions food science labs

you must select all technology areas before continuing. amplification immunoassays chromatography cell biology western blot quality controls quality controls western blot cell biology chromatography immunoassays amplification technology areas amplification immunoassays chromatography cell biology western blot quality controls

incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect that is incorrect. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that is correct! continue continue continue continue continue continue knowledge check #1 clinical diagnostics group quality systems quality systems quality systems quality systems core diagnostics core diagnostics core diagnostics core diagnostics immunohematology immunohematology immunohematology immunohematology clinical systems clinical systems clinical systems clinical systems infectious disease infectious disease infectious disease infectious disease clinical immunology clinical immunology clinical immunology clinical immunology life science group digital biology digital biology digital biology digital biology food science food science food science food science gene expression gene expression gene expression gene expression protein purification protein purification protein purification protein purification protein quantitation protein quantitation protein quantitation protein quantitation flow and antibody flow and antibody flow and antibody flow and antibody drag each business name, on the left, into the appropriate section: the clinical diagnostics group or the life science group.

incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect that is incorrect. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's is correct! continue continue continue continue continue continue knowledge check #2 clinical diagnostics group life science group sort the customer into the bio-rad business group that they are (primarily) supported by. drag each customer, on the bottom, into the appropriate section:

conclusion describe the different types of customers that bio-rad supports define bio-rad’s product areas describe the two exciting markets that bio-rad sells into: life sciences and clinical diagnostics explain how all roles at bio-rad help to advance science and save lives
